page.title: 06TEXTILES IN FORFAR
page.content: {Weaving.}Don Brothers make jute and polyethylene to put on the backs of carpets.They are used to make the carpet thicker so it will last longer.They also use a shuttle and that makes the cross-way weft threads. The two products are sometimes made into bags and some folk use them to put weeds and grass and all different kinds of things in.The products are transported to other factories where they are made into other articles. {Transport }Don Brothers have their headquarters on St.James Road.It has all the offices and the lorry depot. There are about 20 lorries in the fleet.Dons don't just have lorries. They have all different sizes of vans. They also have factories in Dundee 14 miles from here.Dons is the biggest employer in Forfar.The lorry drivers all start at 6am and finish at 5pm.
